member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.CampaignController.Finish(System.Int32)
member.summary: Finishes campaign and data will not be tracked anymore. Doesn't finish already finished campaign.

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.CampaignController.Launch(System.Int32)
member.summary:
The method launches a campaign. This includes the following steps:
Campaign will start tracking data
All linked page assets will be published
All linked email assets will be sent
Doesn't launch an already launched campaign or a campaign from a different site.
member.remarks: When pages are published is set to . Also is reset if date is set to past. Furthermore, pages under workflow are left untouched and all culture variants are published.

member.name: T:CMS.WebAnalytics.WebAnalyticsService
member.summary:
Web analytics can be tracked in 2 ways. The first is to track web analytics right on each request, the second is to log web analytics with a WebService that is called by AJAX call from a client. The latter method makes web analytics more precise, because it doesn't log web crawlers, RSS readers and other non-human traffic that can't execute JavaScript code. That's why this method is default.
The JavaScript call is added to a page on event, see for more.

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.WebAnalyticsService.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. Adds header telling the crawlers not to index this service page.

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.WebAnalyticsService.LogSearch(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method for logging on-site search keywords. Ajax call that calls this method is called in SearchResults WebPart.
member.param: A keyword that has been searched
A NodeAliasPath of a page on which is processed the AJAX call
A culture of a page on which is processed the AJAX call
member.returns: "ok" string if everything went ok
member.exception: Logging by JS is not enabled

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.WebAnalyticsService.LogBannerHit(System.String)
member.summary: Method for logging banner hit (=banner view). Ajax call that calls this method is called in BannerRotator WebPart.
member.param: ID of a banner that's being viewed
member.returns: "ok" string if everything went ok
member.exception: Logging by JS is not enabled

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.WebAnalyticsService.LogHits(System.Object)
member.summary: Method for logging most of web analytics (page view, browser type, countries, ..). See code comments for more details. Web analytics that doesn't make sense to log via JavaScript (RSS crawlers, 404s, ..) are omitted.
member.param:
Dictionary of all parameters that go to the web service. This is different than in other web service methods, because you can modify items that are being sent to the web service with event and than process those parameters with event.
is used because IDictionary cannot be serialized to XML, thus Get request to WebAnalyticsService.asmx always threw exception.
member.returns: "ok" string if everything went ok; null or exception message otherwise

member.summary: Method that converts Object to Dictionary{String, String}.

member.summary: Checks if all required parameters are present and extracts typed representation of the parameters for the LogHits method.
member.returns: Typed representation of the LogHits parameters

member.summary: Service for generating JavaScript code which is able to call the external web service via AJAX. member.summary: Returns script which logs Search statistics asynchronously.

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.IWebAnalyticsServiceScriptsGenerator.GetLogHitsScriptWithSubstitute(System.String)
member.summary: Returns script which logs page views and other hits asynchronously. The script does not contain the actual parameters. There is a placeholder at the location where parameters would be and this placeholder should be replaced by the actual parameters before sending page output to the client browser. This two-step rendering is required, because of the output cache mechanism. At first, there is a universal script rendered and saved into cache. This universal script is then updated with values specific for the current request before sending HTTP response back to the client browser.
member.param: String which will be placed at the location where parameters would normally be

member.summary: Returns parameters of the LogHits call in JSON format.

Url of the page where the user came from (http referrer). Can be null
